page.title: 10BANKS PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: WE INTERVIEWED THE CHAIRMAN OF BANKS PARISH COUNCIL.BANKS' ORIGINAL NAME WAS THE PARISH OF NORTH MEOLS. THE CHAIRMAN ENJOYS HER JOB VERY MUCH AND HAS BEEN CONTINUALLY ELECTED CHAIR MAN FOR THE LAST SIX TIMES.SHE CHOSE THIS JOB BECAUSE SHE IS INTERESTED IN THE BANKS COMMUNITY. THERE ARE NINE ELECTED MEMBERS ON THE COUNCIL,SEVEN ARE FROM BANKS AND TWO FROM CROSSENS.THE VICE CHAIRMAN TAKES THE MEETINGS IF THE CHAIRMAN IS ABSENT. THE JOB OF THE PARISH CLERK IS TO KEEP THE PARISH LOG BOOK AND ACCOUNTS.SHE KEEPS "THE MINUTES" OF EVERY MEETING. IT IS AN IMPORTANT JOB BECAUSE IT IS THE RECORD OF EVERYTHING DONE BY THE PARISH COUNCIL. THE MEETINGS ARE HELD ON THE FIRST TUESDAY OF EVERY MONTH UNLESS ONE IS CALLED OTHERWISE.
